meanings.definition: To be positioned at the front or forefront of something.
meanings.sent1: The brave knight fronted the army in battle.
meanings.sent2: The leader fronted the group during the march.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat fronted the line to see what was happening.
meanings.sent4: The sun fronted the sky, casting its warm light over the land.
meanings.sent5: The determined athlete fronted the race, eager to win.

meanings.definition: To confront or face something directly.
meanings.sent1: She fronted her fears and decided to speak up.
meanings.sent2: He fronted the challenge head-on without hesitation.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel fronted the nut thief with a stern look.
meanings.sent4: The detective fronted the suspect, ready to ask tough questions.
meanings.sent5: The student fronted the difficult exam with confidence.

meanings.definition: To present oneself or something in a prominent or forward position.
meanings.sent1: The singer fronted the band with charisma and style.
meanings.sent2: The model fronted the fashion show, showcasing the latest designs.
meanings.sent3: The comedian fronted the audience, ready to deliver jokes.
meanings.sent4: The CEO fronted the company's new product launch with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent5: The artist fronted the gallery exhibition, displaying their masterpieces.
